The young man was taciturn and never laughed, but he was a hard worker and quickly learned his trade, making the couple happy. In fact, he was a fallen angel, and if he found the answers to the \"three propositions\" given to him by God, he could return to heaven. It was a difficult question asking what is love? What is death? Six years pass, and one day a woman with twin girls appears at Semyon's shop...\nIn 2020, we live in a world that has completely changed due to the coronavirus pandemic. What do we rely on to support our lives now, and for whom do we live our lives?A 140-year-old masterpiece by a world-renowned literary giant has been revived as a manga, offering hints to the answer."},"links":{"amz":"https://www.amazon.co.jp/-/en/レフ・トルストイ-ebook/dp/B08GF9JB6N/ref=tmm_kin_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8\u0026qid=\u0026sr=","bw":"de2e50523e-9ca0-49ec-b25f-8049fdf35c70","ebj":"https://ebookjapan.yahoo.co.jp/books/602167/"},"originalLanguage":"ja","contentRating":"safe","tags":[{"id":"b9af3a63-f058-46de-a9a0-e0c13906197a","name":{"en":"Drama"}}]}

d79751bb-a605-4b25-8334-8078730ee50e:::||@!@||:::2023-12-01T01:11:20:::||@!@||:::{"id":"d79751bb-a605-4b25-8334-8078730ee50e","title":{"en":"Revenge [Complete Edition] + Joya Kagemaru short story collection"},"altTitles":[{"ja":"復讐記〔完全版〕+影丸穣也短編集"}],"lastChapter":"3","description":{"en":"Original work by Alexandre Dumas\n--\"The Count of Monte Cristo\"--\nEnvy, lies, intrigue, betrayal, lamentation, anger, \u003c /span\u003e Full of realism Producing a classic revenge drama!! Ikki Kajiwara \u0026 Jōya Kagemaru combination\nGrudge, revenge and sadness...!\n\nJoya Kagemaru Simultaneously included short works \"The Man Who Came from the Graveyard\" and \"Giant Mask\"!!\n\nSynopsis\nEarly 19th century, France. With a new position as captain and a beautiful fiancée, young sailor Edmond Dantes is at the peak of happiness. However, he is suddenly accused of something he doesn't remember and is forced into Château d'If, the island of coffins. Dantes, who is experiencing the height of despair, meets Priest Faria, who is passionate about escape from prison and learning, and finds hope in learning. It has been 14 years since he was imprisoned...Dante realized that he had been trapped by his three friends and the prosecutor under the advice of a priest, and he miraculously succeeded in escaping!And he used the knowledge and education that he received from the priest. Armed with gold and silver treasures, he begins to take revenge on the people who drove him to the depths of despair and nightmares!!\n\nExplanation\nEdmond Dantes, who was falsely accused of a crime, was in prison, on the edge of despair and nightmares. Having made a miraculous escape from prison and obtained the treasure, Dantes appears in the Parisian society calling himself \"The Count of Monte Cristo\", vowing to take revenge on those who have captured him!\n\n- A dramatic adaptation of French literary giant Alexandre Dumas's masterpiece, \"The Count of Monte Cristo\" -\nThe epic revenge classic was recreated in a manga magazine by Ikki Kajiwara and Jo Kagemaru, who later collaborated on works such as Karate Baka Ichidai and Giant's Samurai Flame. Also. They serialized Melville's \"Moby Dick'' in \"Weekly Shonen Magazine''\nin 1968, and this is their second work to adapt a classic into a graphic novel. Ikki Kajiwara, who uses sports and martial arts as his subject matter to vividly portray the spirit and perseverance of the protagonist Edmond Dantes,\nExpressing anger, Joya Kagemaru makes you feel the strength in each frame with a realistic and tense graphic novel... That story is \"Revengeki,'' which was serialized in \"Weekly Shonen King'' in 1969. This reprint includes Joya Kagemaru's short stories ``The Man Who Came from the Graveyard'' and \"Giant Mask.'' This is a work that will move readers' hearts without sacrificing the charm of the original work."},"originalLanguage":"ja","publicationDemographic":"shounen","contentRating":"safe","tags":[{"id":"33771934-028e-4cb3-8744-691e866a923e","name":{"en":"Historical"}},{"id":"ac72833b-c4e9-4878-b9db-6c8a4a99444a","name":{"en":"Military"}},{"id":"f4122d1c-3b44-44d0-9936-ff7502c39ad3","name":{"en":"Adaptation"}}]}

Sugoroku, who has just joined the group of casual soldiers, dreams of advancing his career. dee371fc-4f58-4a3d-ab9a-20839e4db5b0:::||@!@||:::2023-12-04T01:17:09:::||@!@||:::{"id":"dee371fc-4f58-4a3d-ab9a-20839e4db5b0","title":{"en":"Lightspeed Esper [Asano Riji version]"},"altTitles":[{"ja":"光速エスパー 【あさのりじ版】"}],"lastChapter":"11","relatedIds":["abea9356-dcf9-41f6-a2d0-a011a181971e"],"description":{"en":"A comic version of the hit special effects drama!!\nHikaru, a young boy raised by esper alien parents, sets out to protect the earth from\nthe clutches of the \"space invaders\" alien Giron. \"Light Speed ​​Esper'' (Nippon Television Network), which aired from 1943 to 1966, is a special effects drama featuring a life-sized hero who is reborn as an invincible light speed esper using a reinforced suit with seven abilities. It was a huge hit. Originally, \"Light Speed ​​Esper'' was a character created by electronics manufacturer Toshiba to be used as a mascot doll for its affiliated shops and for advertisements. In 1966, a comic series was started in Kobunsha's magazine \"Shonen'' by the manga artist Asano Riji, who was in charge of the design. Generally speaking,   when it comes to the manga \"Light Speed ​​Esper,'' the Leiji Matsumoto version that started serialization in the later stages of TV broadcasting is famous, but in a true sense, the roots can be called the Asano Riji version, which was involved in the birth of the mascot. Now, Mary must protect Grandiel's secret identity and comply with the other clauses of her contract, or else her heart will explode! 801626b1-8a28-4870-b12a-8dc58e7ee738:::||@!@||:::2023-12-18T01:17:28:::||@!@||:::{"id":"801626b1-8a28-4870-b12a-8dc58e7ee738","title":{"en":"Human Powder"},"altTitles":[{"ja-ro":"Hito no Ko"},{"ja":"ひとのこ"},{"ja-ro":"Hitonoko"}],"lastChapter":"27.5","description":{"en":"\"Save that person! His death is yours.\"\nThe world's most arrogant millionaire, James Bosschild, is sung by a mysterious revelation. While suffering from mysterious \"scars\" and intense \"pain\" in the forehead, He travels to Japan to meet a stranger \"wanderer\"... On the other hand this \"wanderer\" has caused a turmoil in downtown Tokyo.\n\nNote: On 2019, the manga was cancelled on the magazine Monthly Comic Bunch, published by the editorial Shinchosha. Later in the same year, the license got picked up by the editorial Leed and resumed publishing again on their Comic Border manga service. 28839c58-a8aa-4bc5-bb0a-1f585288a300:::||@!@||:::2023-12-18T01:17:28:::||@!@||:::{"id":"28839c58-a8aa-4bc5-bb0a-1f585288a300","title":{"en":"The Phantom Thief Bat Baron"},"altTitles":[{"ja-ro":"Koumori Danshaku"},{"ja":"こうもり男爵"},{"ja-ro":"Kaitou Koumori Otoko"},{"ja":"怪盗こうもり男爵"},{"ja-ro":"Kaitou Koumori Danshaku"}],"lastChapter":"22","relatedIds":["c73adf39-b289-4ace-80e8-335ab03c8521"],"description":{"en":"London at the beginning of the 20th century. What is the true identity of the mysterious man ``Baron Phantom Thief Bat'' who helps the weak and frustrates the strong? Sachiko Asuka's masterpiece, that romantic and stylish suspense comedy, is finally back! ! Don't miss this masterpiece girls' manga from the Showa era following \"Yukiko Tani\"!\n\nSachiko Asuka's \"The Phantom Thief Bat Baron\" first appeared in Kodansha's \"Weekly Shojo Friend\" in 1967, then Shueisha's \"Weekly Seventeen\" in 1969, Shogakukan's \"Weekly Shojo Comic\" in 1973, and other weekly magazines from three companies. This is a popular suspense comedy series released in. Set in post-World War I London, the story was very popular at the time of its release, depicting a number of incidents surrounding an unknown robber named Baron Bat. In contrast to the stylishness of Baron Bat, who appears with a fluttering black cloak, Professor Isaac Asimov is a versatile genius scientist but a bit clumsy (we implicitly understand that he is Baron Bat!), and a beautiful woman. It features attractive characters such as the strong-willed newspaper reporter Betty, and the story is full of suspense, action, romance, a bit of slapstick, serious scenes with occasional dark shadows of history, and plenty of parody.\nThis fantastic series, which has been difficult to read for many years, has now been compiled into one volume for the first time. In addition, it includes valuable unreleased episodes and two spin-off short stories. This is truly a \"definitive edition!\" that fans of the past cannot miss no matter what.\n\nIn addition, three unique short stories from outside the series are also included. (\"The Strange Story of Elsinore Castle,\" \"Monsieur Monsieur's Great Strategy,\" and \"The Beautiful Vampire\") Even those who come into contact with Sachiko Asuka's works for the first time can enjoy her diverse charm.\nOf course, this is a fulfilling book that also includes an interview with Sachiko Asuka and a list of her works.\n\nSpecial contribution by manga artist Yasuko Sakata. Sakata, who was greatly influenced by Sachiko Asuka's manga, passionately talks about her encounter with Baron Bat on page 4!"},"links":{"amz":"https://www.amazon.co.jp/決定版！怪盗こうもり男爵-立東舎-飛鳥-幸子-ebook/dp/B07XPVZ4KT","bw":"search/?qcat=\u0026word=怪盗こうもり男爵","ebj":"https://ebookjapan.yahoo.co.jp/books/559186/","mu":"jtotflj"},"originalLanguage":"ja","publicationDemographic":"shoujo","contentRating":"safe","tags":[{"id":"33771934-028e-4cb3-8744-691e866a923e","name":{"en":"Historical"}},{"id":"391b0423-d847-456f-aff0-8b0cfc03066b","name":{"en":"Action"}},{"id":"3de8c75d-8ee3-48ff-98ee-e20a65c86451","name":{"en":"Animals"}},{"id":"423e2eae-a7a2-4a8b-ac03-a8351462d71d","name":{"en":"Romance"}},{"id":"87cc87cd-a395-47af-b27a-93258283bbc6","name":{"en":"Adventure"}},{"id":"b9af3a63-f058-46de-a9a0-e0c13906197a","name":{"en":"Drama"}},{"id":"ee968100-4191-4968-93d3-f82d72be7e46","name":{"en":"Mystery"}}]}

6ed28ebe-968d-42c9-8cc6-002b2a5aa49b:::||@!@||:::2023-12-18T01:17:28:::||@!@||:::{"id":"6ed28ebe-968d-42c9-8cc6-002b2a5aa49b","title":{"en":"My Naughty Deity"},"altTitles":[{"pt-br":"Meu Deus É Um Homem Lascivo"},{"en":"My God Is a Lustful Man"},{"en":"My god is a desire maker"},{"ko":"나의 신은 욕망꾸러기"},{"en":"My god of debauchery"}],"availableTranslatedLanguages":["en"],"description":{"en":"Hye-sal, a timid ethics teacher who has lived her whole life without desires, finds that a neighbor who exudes desire and pleasure has moved in next door. With a sexy appearance and a fatal scent, his name is Dionysus, shortened to Dio.\n\nWhen Dio makes divine wine, the essential ingredient required is the deep desires that humans have never fulfilled in their lifetime. The one who possesses that is Hye-sal! All she desires is her repetitive peaceful daily life, without any other dreams or desires.\n\nDio begins relentlessly pestering her, using even divine abilities to awaken the deep desires within Hye-sal.","pt-br":"A reservada professora de ética, Jeon Haesul, levando uma vida sem muitas aspirações, inesperadamente se vê residindo ao lado de uma divindade do desejo e do prazer chamada ‘Dionísio’ ou simplesmente Dio, que exala uma fragrância cativante com uma aparência sedutora. O ingrediente essencial para a criação do vinho por Dio são os desejos profundos e não realizados que os indivíduos carregam ao longo de suas vidas, e Haesul os possui! Tudo o que ela deseja é a tranquilidade rotineira do dia a dia, tendo vivido sem quaisquer outros sonhos ou desejos. Dio, em seus esforços incansáveis ​​para despertar os desejos profundos de Haesul, emprega suas habilidades divinas, transformando a vida dela em uma fonte constante de aborrecimento."},"links":{"engtl":"https://www.webtoons.com/en/romance/my-naughty-deity/list?title_no=6219","mal":"164620","mu":"6uk137x","raw":"https://series.naver.com/comic/detail.series?productNo=10390000"},"originalLanguage":"ko","contentRating":"suggestive","tags":[{"id":"3e2b8dae-350e-4ab8-a8ce-016e844b9f0d","name":{"en":"Long Strip"}},{"id":"423e2eae-a7a2-4a8b-ac03-a8351462d71d","name":{"en":"Romance"}},{"id":"b9af3a63-f058-46de-a9a0-e0c13906197a","name":{"en":"Drama"}},{"id":"e197df38-d0e7-43b5-9b09-2842d0c326dd","name":{"en":"Web Comic"}},{"id":"e5301a23-ebd9-49dd-a0cb-2add944c7fe9","name":{"en":"Slice of Life"}},{"id":"f5ba408b-0e7a-484d-8d49-4e9125ac96de","name":{"en":"Full Color"}}]}

In 1930, he joined Hidezo Kondo's new manga group. \"Bear Cub Korosuke'', which was serialized in \"Yonen Club'' beginning in 1935, became popular, but due to his sudden death, he was replaced by Masao Haga. Drawn under the name Fujio Ashizuka, he moved from Toyama to Tokyo and brought it to several publishers, but it was not accepted, and after being introduced by Osamu Tezuka, the company decided to make it into a book. However, because the cover was written by Noboru Oshiro and was published in conjunction with other manga artists' works, the two subsequent reprints had Fujiko draw a new cover and the coupling work was removed, leaving the book as original. It wasn't. This time, we have achieved a complete reprint that faithfully reproduces the text in two colors based on the original that Leiji Matsumoto had preserved.\nEarth was frozen by the ice bomb used by the S Federation during World War III. What the boy, who was confined in a shelter and revived 100 years later, sees is an Earth that has recovered from the damage caused by the ice bomb and has been rebuilt as a utopia with advanced scientific civilization. A masterpiece of apocalyptic science fiction that is still relevant today.\n\nThe first book and only newly illustrated work \"UTOPIA: The Last World War\" (1953) is finally available with two-color pages fully reproduced!\nAnd a must-have for fans, which combines all 26 works of the phantom first serial and manga artist's debut work \"Tenshi no Tama-chan\" (1951), whose total number was unknown for a long time, for the first time.
